summary: Email correspondence between defense attorneys and Assistant U.S. Attorneys regarding the logistics of discovery production in the case against Ghislaine Maxwell. The emails discuss the delivery of hard drives containing discovery materials and the scheduling of a prison visit for Maxwell to review a secure laptop.

persons.name: Christian Everdell
persons.context: Primary defense attorney corresponding with prosecutors about discovery delivery and scheduling a prison visit for his client, Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Discovery Hard Drive Delivery
events.description: Defense attorneys deliver two hard drives containing discovery materials to the U.S. Attorney's Office.

events.title: Scheduled Prison Visit for Laptop Review
events.description: A prison visit is scheduled for Ghislaine Maxwell to review a secure laptop containing discovery materials from 8am to 3pm.

locations: MDC (Metropolitan Detention Center, likely in New York)
keyFacts: The document is email correspondence from October 2020 regarding discovery production in United States v. Maxwell.
Defense attorneys delivered hard drives with discovery materials to prosecutors and were arranging for Ghislaine Maxwell to review materials on a secure laptop in prison.
The defense team included Christian Everdell, Laura Menninger, Jeff Pagliuca, Bobbi Sternheim, and Mark S. Cohen.
A prison visit for Maxwell was scheduled for Friday, October 23, 2020, from 8am to 3pm for the purpose of reviewing the secure laptop.
The correspondence shows ongoing pretrial preparation and evidence sharing between the defense and prosecution.
